com.foreach.across.core.context.bootstrap

Class AcrossBootstrapConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.core.context.bootstrap.AcrossBootstrapConfig

  • public class AcrossBootstrapConfig
extends Object
    Represents the global bootstrap configuration for the AcrossContext.

      • excludeFromModule

        public boolean excludeFromModule(String moduleName,
                                 String... classNames)
        Method to exclude one or more annotated classes from a module bootstrap configuration. If the configuration class has been added previously at any point during bootstrap configuration, it will be removed again. This method is safe to use even if the classes are not present on the classpath.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - Unique name of the module in the context.
        classNames - Annotated class names.
        Returns:
        True if the module was present.

      • excludeFromModule

        public boolean excludeFromModule(String moduleName,
                                 Class... annotatedClasses)
        Method to exclude one or more annotated classes from a module bootstrap configuration. If the configuration class has been added previously at any point during bootstrap configuration, it will be removed again.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - Unique name of the module in the context.
        annotatedClasses - Annotated classes.
        Returns:
        True if the module was present.

      • extendModule

        public boolean extendModule(String moduleName,
                            String... classNames)
        Method to add one or more configuration classes to a module bootstrap configuration. The module is identified by its name. This method is safe to use in all circumstances: if the module is not configured in the context only the return value will be false but no exception will occur. If the class with the name is not present on the classpath, it will be skipped.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - Unique name of the module in the context.
        classNames - Annotated class names.
        Returns:
        True if the module was present.

      • extendModule

        public boolean extendModule(String moduleName,
                            boolean deferred,
                            boolean optional,
                            String... classNames)
        Method to add one or more configuration classes to a module bootstrap configuration. The module is identified by its name. This method is safe to use in all circumstances: if the module is not configured in the context only the return value will be false but no exception will occur. If the class with the name is not present on the classpath, it will be skipped.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - Unique name of the module in the context.
        deferred - false if the configuration classes should be added before the initial configuration
        optional - true if the configuration classes should not force the module ApplicationContext to start
        classNames - Annotated class names.
        Returns:
        True if the module was present.

      • extendModule

        public boolean extendModule(String moduleName,
                            Class... configurationClasses)
        Method to add one or more configuration classes to a module bootstrap configuration. The module is identified by its name. This method is safe to use in all circumstances: if the module is not configured in the context only the return value will be false but no exception will occur.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - Unique name of the module in the context.
        configurationClasses - Annotated class instances.
        Returns:
        True if the module was present.

      • extendModule

        public boolean extendModule(String moduleName,
                            boolean deferred,
                            boolean optional,
                            Class... configurationClasses)
        Method to add one or more configuration classes to a module bootstrap configuration. The module is identified by its name. This method is safe to use in all circumstances: if the module is not configured in the context only the return value will be false but no exception will occur.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - Unique name of the module in the context.
        deferred - false if the configuration classes should be added before the initial configuration
        optional - true if the configuration classes should not force the module ApplicationContext to start
        configurationClasses - Annotated class instances.
        Returns:
        True if the module was present.

      • extendModule

        public boolean extendModule(String moduleName,
                            ModuleConfigurationExtension... extensions)
        Method to add one or more configuration extensions to a module bootstrap configuration. The module is identified by its name. This method is safe to use in all circumstances: if the module is not configured in the context only the return value will be false but no exception will occur.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - Unique name of the module in the context.
        extensions - Configuration extensions
        Returns:
        True if the module was present.

      • extendModule

        public boolean extendModule(String moduleName,
                            ApplicationContextConfigurer... configurers)
        Method to add one or more configurers to a module bootstrap configuration. The module is identified by its name. This method is safe to use in all circumstances: if the module is not configured in the context only the return value will be false but no exception will occur.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - Unique name of the module in the context.
        configurers - Configurers to add to the bootstrap.
        Returns:
        True if the module was present.

      • extendModule

        public boolean extendModule(String moduleName,
                            BeanFilter... exposeFilters)
        Method to add one or more expose filter to a module bootstrap configuration.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - Unique name of the module in the context.
        exposeFilters - BeanFilter instances to add as additional expose filters.
        Returns:
        True if the module was present.
